intro: Onosma fastigiata subsp. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean upright everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and dense clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, typically at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
